original:
In 2010, the Southern United States had the highest total number of individuals aged 65 years and older, as well as those aged 85 years and older. However, when considering proportions, the Northeast region had the largest percentage of adults aged 65 and older, accounting for 14.1% of its population. This was followed by the Midwest at 13.5%, the South at 13.0%, and the West at 11.9%.
